meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be tuned.
meanings.sent1: The tunability of the guitar strings allowed for perfect harmony.
meanings.sent2: Musicians appreciate the tunability of their instruments to create beautiful melodies.
meanings.sent3: The tunability of the radio made it easy to find the right station for the road trip.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a natural tunability that resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The tunability of the piano keys made learning to play more enjoyable.

meanings.definition: The ability to adjust or change in pitch or frequency.
meanings.sent1: The tunability of the radio dial made it simple to find different stations.
meanings.sent2: Engineers work on improving the tunability of electronic devices for better performance.
meanings.sent3: The tunability of the car engine allowed for a smooth ride up the steep hill.
meanings.sent4: His voice had a tunability that could reach the highest notes effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The tunability of the guitar amplifier helped create the perfect sound for the concert.
